content.title: Anastomotic Pseudoaneurysm
content.definition: A pulsatile hematoma contained by surrounding tissues at a vascular anastomosis, resulting from partial disruption of the suture line without a complete true aneurysm wall.

clinical_features.pulsatile_mass: Expanding pulsatile mass at graft anastomosis
clinical_features.infection: Signs of graft infection if etiology

clinical_features.duplex: Characteristic yin-yang flow pattern, neck visualization

clinical_features.open_repair: Traditional approach - excision and interposition graft
clinical_features.infected: Graft excision, extra-anatomic bypass, in situ reconstruction
clinical_features.thrombin: Not typically used for anastomotic pseudoaneurysms
